duck: The Compleat Housewife or Accomplish'd Gentlewoman's Companion, an English cookbook and how to manual, also the first published cookbook in the United States
housewife definition: a married woman in charge of a household.

Soccer mom - The phrase soccer mom broadly refers to a North American middle-class suburban woman who spends a significant amount of her time transporting her school-age children to their youth sporting ...

Women's work - Women's work or woman's work is a term used particularly in the West to indicate work that is believed to be exclusively the domain of women and associates particular tasks with the female...

A housewife  is a woman whose main occupation is running or managing the family's home—caring for and educating her children, cooking and storing food, buying goods the family needs in day to day life, cleaning and maintaining the home, making clothes for the family, etc.—and who is generally not employed outside the home.
Gender roles in agriculture - Gender roles in agriculture are a frequent subject of study by sociologists and farm economists.

A housewife  is a woman whose main occupation is running or managing the family's home—caring for and educating her children, cooking and storing food, buying goods the family needs in day to day life, cleaning and maintaining the home, making clothes for the family, etc.—and who is generally not employed outside the home.

(1801-1859). The Russian Museum, St. Petersburg, Russia]] A 'housewife' is a
 woman whose main occupation is running or managing the family's home—caring for
 and educating her children, cooking and storing food, buying goods the family
 needs in day to day life, cleaning and maintaining the home, making clothes for
 the family, etc.—and who is generally not employed outside the
 home.<ref>[http://www.macmillandictionary.com/dictionary/american/housewife
 Macmillan dictionary definitionj]</ref> Merriam Webster describes a housewife
 as a married woman who is in charge of her household.
 '[[Homemaking|Homemaker]]' is a mainly
 American<ref>[http://dictionary.cambridge.org/define.asp?key=37659&dict=CALD
 Cambridge Advanced Learner's Dictionary]. Retrieved March 25,
 2008.</ref><ref>The [http://corpus.byu.edu/bnc British National Corpus]
 contains 634 occurrences of housewife and 18 of homemaker; the
 [http://www.americancorpus.org BYU Corpus of American English] contains 972
 occurrences of housewife and 633 of homemaker. Retrieved March 25, 2008.</ref>
 gender-neutral term for a housewife or also a stay-at-home dad. 'SAHM' is an
 abbreviation that refers to a 'stay-at-home mother' / "stay at home mom".

The term may sometimes be used in a derogatory sense, in contrast to a
career woman.
